summary: The Supreme Court Ethics, Recusal, and Transparency Act of 2025 aims to increase ethical standards and transparency within the Supreme Court. Key provisions include establishing a code of conduct for Supreme Court justices, creating a process for handling complaints against justices, setting minimum gift and disclosure standards, clarifying circumstances requiring judicial disqualification, authorizing review of disqualification motions, and requiring disclosure of gifts and lobbying contacts by parties and amici. The bill also mandates studies on compliance with existing recusal laws and audits of amicus disclosures.
